frameDefinitions: An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue.
The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim.
An Agent prepares for an Activity. '' 'The troops were preparing themselves for the mission.'
An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as characterized as having an emotion of fear concerning a particular Topic or as evoked by a Stimulus.
An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.
frameExamples: Jason <t>completed</t> grading the papers late Sunday night.
Rod saw his father <t>beating</t> his mother.
The troops were <t>preparing</t> themselves for the mission.
As soon as he stepped out of the bar he was <t>set</t> upon by four men in ski-masks.
I was <t>scared</t> by a bump in the night.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Agent</fen> who has finished an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> has finished.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> finishes.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> finishes the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Agent</fen> is the person causing the <fen>Victim</fen>'s injury.

The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured.  If the <fen>Victim</fen> is included in the phrase indicating <fen>Body_part</fen>, the <fen>Victim</fen> role is tagged on a second role layer (see 3rd example).
The <fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.
The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the <fen>Victim</fen>
<fen>Time</fen> identifies the time when the harm-causing event occurs.
<fen>Place</fen> identifies the place where the harm causing event occurs.
An <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is preparing.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to have a particular emotional state.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> affects the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> affects the <fen>Experiencer</fen>
listRoleExamples: <fex>Jolosa, who</fex> broke a rival player 's jaw, was told to model his play on the England striker.
Someone bashed <fex>him</fex> on the back of the head with a heavy smooth object.
Someone bashed him <fex>on the back of the head</fex> with a heavy smooth object.
Riot police in Nairobi clubbed four women unconscious <fex>on March 3</fex>.
Boys  are punched <fex>at school</fex> for payback
The mysterious fighter attacked <fex>the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.
<fex>The mysterious fighter</fex> attacked the guardsmen with a sabre.
<fex>As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> he was set upon by four men in ski-masks.
Then Jon-O's forces ambushed them <fex>on the left flank</fex> from a line of low hills.
